title: Sexual Health Inequities and Sexual Well-Being
description: This course provides an overview of sexual health inequities and sexual well-being. Students will engage critically and reflexively in topics related to race/ethnicity, gender, and sexual orientation. Open to the following Department of Psychology majors only: PC25, PC26, PC28, PC29, PC30, PC31, PC32, PC33, PC34, PC35. Prerequisites: upper-division standing, PSYC 60, PSYC 70, PSYC 172.
